trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with 15Five | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with 15Five | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use 15Five with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use 15Five with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with 15Five
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with 15Five

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and 15Five.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and 15Five.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A 15Five single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A 15Five single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to 15Five will be able to single sign into the application at your 15Five company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to 15Five will be able to single sign into the application at your 15Five company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for 15Five
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for 15Five

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for 15Five
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for 15Five

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for 15Five.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for 15Five.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for 15Five, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for 15Five, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type 15Five.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type 15Five.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select 15Five, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select 15Five, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>15Five</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>15Five</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to 15Five with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to 15Five with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the 15Five application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the 15Five application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to 15Five page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to 15Five page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the 15Five Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.15Five.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the 15Five Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.15Five.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at 15Five page, click Download metadata, and then forward the metadata file to the 15Five support team.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at 15Five page, click Download metadata, and then forward the metadata file to the 15Five support team.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Single sign-on needs to be enabled by the 15Five support team.
trans-unit.target: Single sign-on needs to be enabled by the 15Five support team.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into 15Five, they must be provisioned into 15Five.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into 15Five, they must be provisioned into 15Five.

trans-unit.source: In the case of 15Five, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of 15Five, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Log in to your 15Five company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your 15Five company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Manage Company.
trans-unit.target: Go to Manage Company.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage Company</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage Company</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Go to People \> Add People.
trans-unit.target: Go to People \> Add People.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>People</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>People</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Add New Person section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Add New Person section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add New Person</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add New Person</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the First Name, Last Name, Title, Email address of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the First Name, Last Name, Title, Email address of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click Done.
trans-unit.target: Click Done.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD account holder will receive an email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD account holder will receive an email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other 15Five user account creation tools or APIs provided by 15Five to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other 15Five user account creation tools or APIs provided by 15Five to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to 15Five, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to 15Five, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the 15Five **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the 15Five **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
